revised_title: The Viscosity of Gases at High Exhaustions: A Study by William Crookes
tldr: This paper by William Crookes investigates the viscosity of gases at high exhaustions, focusing on air. The author's experiments show that the viscosity remains constant up to a certain point of rarefaction, after which it decreases. This study provides insights into the behavior of gases at low pressures and the role of molecular collisions in their internal friction.
